Welcome to AddressBookAPI’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

A function that checks the health of the API.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession) – An instance of the AsyncSession class used to interact with the database.

Returns:

A dictionary containing a welcome message if the health check is successful.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If there is an error connecting to the database or if the database is not configured correctly.

async main.startup()¶

Initializes the application when it starts up.

This function is called automatically when the application starts up. It connects to the Redis server using the configuration provided and initializes the FastAPILimiter.

REST API repository AddressBook¶

async src.repository.address_book.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The contact information to be created.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user creating the contact.

Returns:

The created contact object.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.address_book.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Delete a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to be deleted.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session object.

  • user (User) – The user object associated with the contact.

Returns:

The deleted contact object if it exists, otherwise None.

Return type:

Contact or None

async src.repository.address_book.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieves a contact from the database based on the provided contact ID and user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user object.

Returns:

The retrieved contact, or None if not found.

Return type:

Contact or None

async src.repository.address_book.get_contacts(name: str, surname: str, email: str, birthdays: bool, limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieves contacts based on the given search criteria.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name to search for in the contacts.

  • surname (str) – The surname to search for in the contacts.

  • email (str) – The email to search for in the contacts.

  • birthdays (bool) – Specifies if contacts with upcoming birthdays should be included.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

  • offset (int) – The number of contacts to skip before retrieving.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session to use for executing the query.

  • user (User) – The user associated with the contacts.

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.address_book.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Update a contact with the given contact ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to be updated.

  • body (ContactSchema) – The updated contact information.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user performing the update.

Returns:

The updated contact object.

Return type:

Contact

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(user: User, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

Update the avatar URL for a user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object to update.

  • url (str or None) – The new avatar URL. If None, the user’s avatar will be removed.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

Update the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object to update.

  • token (str or None) – The new refresh token. Pass None to remove the refresh token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

REST API routes AddressBook¶

async src.routes.address_book.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(current_user_dependency))¶

Creates a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The contact data to be created.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The database session.

  • user (User, optional) – The current user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.address_book.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(current_user_dependency))¶

Delete a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to be deleted.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The current authenticated user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

async src.routes.address_book.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(current_user_dependency))¶

Retrieves a contact using the specified contact ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

  • user (User) – The current active user.

Returns:

The retrieved contact.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found (HTTP 404 NOT FOUND).

async src.routes.address_book.get_contacts(name: str = Query(None), surname: str = Query(None), email: str = Query(None), birthdays: bool = Query(False), limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(current_user_dependency))¶

Retrieves contacts based on the provided filters.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Filter contacts by name. Must be between 1 and 50 characters long.

  • surname (str) – Filter contacts by surname. Must be between 1 and 50 characters long.

  • email (str) – Filter contacts by email. Must be between 1 and 50 characters long.

  • birthdays (bool) – If True, only show contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of contacts to retrieve. Must be between 10 and 500.

  • offset (int) – Number of contacts to skip before retrieving the results. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session to use for retrieving contacts.

  • user (User) – User object representing the current active user.

Returns:

List of contacts that match the provided filters.

Return type:

list[ContactResponse]

async src.routes.address_book.update_contact(body: ContactSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(current_user_dependency))¶

Update a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactSchema) – The updated contact information.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to be updated.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The asynchronous database session.

  • user (User) – The authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact information.

Return type:

ContactResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found in the database.

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, request: Request, user_manager: BaseUserManager[UP, ID] = Depends(get_user_manager))¶

Verify a user’s email address using a confirmation token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The confirmation token.

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • user_manager (BaseUserManager[models.UP, models.ID]) – The user manager.

Returns:

The user object after verification.

Return type:

UserRead

Raises:

HTTPException – If the confirmation token is invalid or the user does not exist. If the user is already verified.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(username: str, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieves the email of the specified user from the database and returns it as a file response.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – The username of the user whose email is being requested.

  • response (Response) – The response object used to send the file response.

  • db (AsyncSession, optional) – The asynchronous database session. Defaults to the session obtained from the get_db dependency.

Returns:

The file response containing the requested email as a PNG image.

Return type:

FileResponse

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.update_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(current_user_dependency), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user_manager: BaseUserManager[UP, ID] = Depends(get_user_manager))¶

Update the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The file containing the new avatar image.

  • user (User) – The user for whom the avatar is being updated.

  • db (AsyncSession) – The database session.

  • user_manager (BaseUserManager[models.UP, models.ID]) – The user manager.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

UserRead

Dependencies:

  • RateLimiter: A rate limiter dependency that limits the number of requests.

  • current_active_user: A dependency function that retrieves the current active user.

  • get_db: A dependency function that retrieves the database session.

  • get_user_manager: A dependency function that retrieves the user manager.

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.UserManager(user_db: SQLAlchemyUserDatabase, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks)¶

Bases: UUIDIDMixin, BaseUserManager[User, UUID]

User manager class responsible for managing user operations.

Parameters:

  • user_db (SQLAlchemyUserDatabase) – The user database.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks.

cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=0,db=0>>>¶
async create(user_create: UC, safe: bool = False, request: Request | None = None) → UP¶

Create a new user.

Parameters:

  • user_create (schemas.UC) – The user creation data.

  • safe (bool, optional) – Flag indicating whether to create a safe user or not. Defaults to False.

  • request (Optional[Request], optional) – The request object. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The created user.

Return type:

models.UP

Raises:

UserAlreadyExists – If a user with the same email already exists.

async on_after_forgot_password(user: User, token: str, request: Request | None = None)¶

Handle the event that occurs after a user has requested to reset their password.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user who requested the password reset.

  • token (str) – The password reset token.

  • request (Optional[Request], optional) – The HTTP request associated with the password reset, defaults to None.

async on_after_login(user: UP, request: Request | None = None, response: Response | None = None)¶

Asynchronously handles the logic after a user has successfully logged in.

Parameters:

  • user (models.UP) – An instance of the UP model representing the logged-in user.

  • request (Optional[Request]) – An optional instance of the Request class representing the HTTP request.

  • response (Optional[Response]) – An optional instance of the Response class representing the HTTP response.

Returns:

The cached user data retrieved from the cache.

Return type:

Any

async on_after_register(user: User, request: Request | None = None)¶

Triggered after a user is registered.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The registered user.

  • request (Optional[Request]) – The request associated with the registration.

async on_after_request_verify(user: User, token: str, request: Request | None = None)¶

Asynchronously verifies a request after it has been processed, by sending an email verification link to the user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user object.

  • token (str) – The verification token.

  • request (Optional[Request], optional) – The request object, defaults to None.

async on_after_update(user: UP, update_dict: Dict[str, Any], request: Request | None = None) → None¶

A function that is called after an update is made.

Parameters:

  • user (models.UP) – The user object.

  • update_dict (Dict[str, Any]) – A dictionary containing the update information.

  • request (Optional[Request]) – An optional request object.

async on_after_verify(user: UP, request: Request | None = None) → None¶

A function that is called after a user has been verified.

Parameters:

  • user (models.UP) – The user object that has been verified.

  • request (Optional[Request]) – An optional request object.

reset_password_token_secret: SecretType = 'secret_jwt'¶
verification_token_secret: SecretType = 'secret_jwt'¶
src.services.auth.get_jwt_strategy() → JWTStrategy¶

Get the JWT strategy.

Returns:

An instance of JWTStrategy.

Return type:

JWTStrategy

async src.services.auth.get_user_manager(background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, user_db: SQLAlchemyUserDatabase = Depends(get_user_db))¶

An asynchronous function that returns a user manager.

Parameters:

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – The background tasks.

  • user_db (SQLAlchemyUserDatabase, optional) – The user database. Defaults to the result of get_user_db.

Returns:

The user manager.

Return type:

UserManager

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email_forgot_password(email: EmailStr, username: str, token: str, host: str)¶

Send a forgot password email to the specified email address.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address of the user.

  • username (str) – The username of the user.

  • token (str) – The token for password reset.

  • host (str) – The host URL for the application.

async src.services.email.send_email_verification(email: EmailStr, username: str, token: str, host: str)¶

Sends an email verification to the specified email address.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The email address to send the verification to.

  • username (str) – The username associated with the email address.

  • token (str) – The verification token.

  • host (str) – The host URL.

Raises:

ConnectionErrors – If there is an error connecting to the email server.
